alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff, northwestern Banner, southwestern Sioux, Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Jay Em to 6 miles southwest of Hawk Springs to 6 miles west of Gun Barrel. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lingle, La Grange, Lyman, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Huntley, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Veteran, Henry and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County
